question_1.question: When is it recommended to tag fields for data impact documentation in a data warehouse?

options.option_a: After the data reaches the endpoint
options.option_b: As early in the data flow as possible
options.option_c: Only at the source of the data
options.option_d: Periodically, at every stage of the data flow

question_1.explanation: Tagging fields early in the data flow allows the documentation to capture the complete data journey from source to endpoint.

question_2.question: What must be done before a field can be tagged in the data warehouse documentation process?

options.option_d: The field must be approved by a supervisor

question_2.explanation: Tags need to be created before they can be used to tag fields.

question_3.question: How do you add a new tag in the Solution Explorer?

options.option_a: Double-click Tags and select Add tag
options.option_b: Right click Tags and select Delete tag
options.option_c: Left click Tags and choose Add tag
options.option_d: Right click Tags and click Add tag

question_3.explanation: To add a new tag, you right click on Tags in the Solution Explorer and click Add tag.

question_4.question: What is the correct way to add a tag to a field?

options.option_a: Right click the field, click Tags and select the appropriate tag
options.option_b: Drag and drop the tag onto the field
options.option_c: Left click the field and type the tag name
options.option_d: Use a special tagging tool provided in the software

question_4.explanation: To add a tag to a field, you right click the field, click Tags, and then select the appropriate tag to be added.
